title: Ticket #672: Overhaul manual section: Installation Instructions
description: Our installation instructions are outdated, especially for the common case of a set of homogeneous platforms on a shared file system. An overhaul of the entire section will benefit all, and probably reduce the headaches of new Condor admins.

2013-Apr-24 11:37:50 by nwp:
In the manual, it states:

INSTALL: these installation instructions

The contents of INSTALL are: 

    Complete installation directions for Condor can be found in the
    Condor Manual.  The complete Condor Manual is available for
    download or online browsing at URL:
       http://www.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual

This seems to be circular. Can we just get rid of INSTALL in the manual?

2013-Apr-24 11:48:00 by smoler:
By taking this ticket, you get to make such decisions. Please make sure that the code, like the contents of INSTALL, match what is in the manual. So,
  1. If you decide to keep the INSTALL file, then make sure its contents are correct (update the link), and also change the description in the manual to say something to the point that the INSTALL file contains a URL pointing to this portion of the manual.
  2. If you decide to remove the INSTALL file, you'll have to do that in the code base, and then also update the manual so it does not mention the no-longer-existing file.

2013-Apr-24 11:50:44 by nwp:
I am going to follow the policy of "When in doubt, throw it out". smoler will of course get a chance to review before we commit to the release branch.

2013-May-29 09:03:02 by nwp:
I did some pruning here, but overall the structure is left intact. It was a good exercise to go through the instructions and install HTCondor from a tarball in a VM. Taking into account most people are probably using native packaging, it is probably an effort that is less useful than one might think. It might be a good idea to go back through this with an engagement partner who is willing to sit through a (non-native, tarball) install of HTCondor and go through the installation from start to finish on a real pool.
